alert.note: Alert for Allen; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wilson, northwestern Neosho, southern Woodson and southwestern Allen Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buffalo, or 10 miles south of Yates Center, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Humboldt, Buffalo, Benedict, Earlton, Coyville, Cross Timbers State Park, Toronto Lake, Petrolia, Rose, and Chanute Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
